"... To speak plainly: one useful job for the philosopher of science is to sort out the errors and confusions that scientists – especially theoretical physicists – sometimes fall into when they give free rein to a speculative turn of mind. [...] To adapt the economist Keynes’ famous saying: those scientists who claim to have no use for philosophy are most likely in the grip of a bad old philosophy or an insufficiently thought-out new one that they don’t fully acknowledge."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Theorists Who Claim to Not Need Philosophy Are Likely in the Grip of a Bad Philosophy Themselves - Part 3
